gloss: a wide street in London stretching from Trafalgar Square to the Houses of Parliament; site of many government offices / in or characteristic of a region of the United States south of (approximately) the Mason-Dixon line
a thoroughfare (usually including sidewalks) that is lined with buildings / an avenue in Manhattan that separates the east side of Manhattan from the west side

a body of water between Greenland and northeastern Canada; connected with the Arctic Ocean to the north and with the Atlantic Ocean (via the Labrador Sea) to the south; icebound in winter / a boundary line between land and water / of or relating to a basin

a rectangular area in a city surrounded by streets and usually containing several buildings / a wide street in London stretching from Trafalgar Square to the Houses of Parliament; site of many government offices / an avenue in Manhattan that separates the east side of Manhattan from the west side
a narrow boundary / a strong line / a very thin line
